title: Upgrading App (Retaining Feature Access/Settings)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the current Store build version installed from the App Store
And the user has logged in with an entitled account
And the user has set Favorite Team(s)
custom_steps:
When the user overwrites the app with the latest TestFlight Build
And launches the app
custom_expected:
Then the user's login information will be retained
And the user's feature access will be retained
And the user's Favorite Teams will be retained

title: iPhone - Video Launch Points (Partially Automated)
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the app on an iPhone
and navigate to the areas of the app where video highlights are available
custom_steps: When the user attempts to play video from the following sections:

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page video index
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will play from the playlist view
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Videos section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will play from the playlist view
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: News Article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Video token from a News Article
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Scoreboard (expanded game cell)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will play from the playlist view
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Game Wrap
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And rotating to Landscape will play the highlight in Full screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Summary tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Feed tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the highlight opens in Full Screen mode
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Videos section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Condensed Game or Game Recap
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Condensed Game or Game Recap opens in Full Screen mode
And the video can be watched in its entirety

title: In-App Purchase
custom_preconds:
Given the user has a TestFlight build installed
And the user has navigated to a paywall

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Audio Yearly option
And enters a valid iTunes Sandbox account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the transaction is successful
And the user can dismiss the "Connect Purchase" screen
And the user will have Audio access
And the user will not see Lite ads

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the Audio Monthly user then accesses the TV paywall
And purchases TV Monthly successfully
And then links to an MLB account on the "Connect Purchase" screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will have access to MLB.TV and MLB Audio
And the user will not see Lite ads

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user uninstalls the build
And reinstalls the build
And accesses a paywall
And taps the "Restore" button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user's purchases (Audio Monthly and TV Monthly) will be restored
And the user can dismiss the "Connect Purchase" screen
And the user will have Audio and MLB.TV access

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user installs the build on another device
And launches the app
And accesses a paywall
And logs in with their MLB account (FROM STEP 2)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will have access to Audio and MLB.TV

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user uninstalls the build
And reinstalls the build
And the user taps the Audio Monthly option
And enters a valid iTunes Sandbox account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the transaction is successful
And the user can link to their MLB account on the "Connect Purchase" screen
And the user will have Audio access
And the user will not see Lite ads

title: MLB.tv - Switching Feeds
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iPhone and iPad
custom_steps:
When a user is watching an MLB.TV video
and has the OOTSB overlay displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and MLB.TV Premium user taps on a the other feed of the game

Check on iPhone and iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the user is let into the other feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and MLB.TV Premium user taps on a feed that is blacked out

Check on iPhone and iPad

(during in-season only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the blackout message appears

custom_steps_separated.content:
and single team user taps on a the other feed of the game

Check on iPhone and iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the single team message appears restricting them from watching the feed

custom_steps_separated.content: and Audio user is on a Free Game of the Day feed and switches to a MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: in Portrait: Then the user is prompted with the TV paywall

title: MLB.tv - Switching Feeds (Offseason)
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an iPhone and iPad
custom_steps:
When a user is watching an MLB.TV video
and has the OOTSB overlay displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and MLB.TV Premium user taps on a the other feed of the game

Check on iPhone and iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the user is let into the other feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and single team user taps on a the other feed of the game

Check on iPhone and iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the entitlement check appears
and the single team message appears restricting them from watching the feed

custom_steps_separated.content: and Audio user is on a Free Game of the Day feed and switches to a MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: in Portrait: Then the user is prompted with the TV paywall

title: MLB Audio
custom_preconds: Given the user has the MLB app installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user logs in with an Audio-entitled account (MLBAUDIO)
and taps a game to launch an audio feed via the Audio EPG (headphones icon)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default audio feed of that game should launch and playback without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user logs in with a TV-entitled account (MLBALL)
and taps a game to launch an audio feed via the Audio EPG (headphones icon)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default audio feed of that game should launch and playback without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user logs in with a Single Team/MLBAUDIO-entitled account 
and taps a game to launch an audio feed via the Audio EPG (headphones icon)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the default audio feed of that game should launch and playback without issue

title: Chromecast
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app has been installed
and the user is on the same network as a Google Chromecast device

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the section header (e.g., News, Team Page, Watch tab)
and taps on the Google Cast icon in the top right corner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an overlay will display
AND all Chromecast devices found on the network will appear
AND all device names will display correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects an available Chromecast device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Google Cast icon will show as enabled
AND it will now appear filled in with white

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the app is connected to a Chromecast device
and the user launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should launch on the Chromecast device
And the user should be taken to the video controller view on their handset

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the app is connected to a Chromecast device
and the user launches VOD content (video highlights, video in news article, Gameday video)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the VOD should launch on the Chromecast device
And the user should be taken to the video controller view on their handset

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify player controls function while casting
(play/pause, mute, Closed Captioning, switching feeds)
custom_steps_separated.expected: The expected behavior should occur on the Chromecast device

title: 10 AM EST Scoreboard Flip (Partially Automated)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on an iOS device with MLB app installed
custom_steps:
When the user opens MLB app
and taps on Scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: when the device date is current date before 10am
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard will show the previous day's games

custom_steps_separated.content: when the device date is current date after 10am
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard will show the current day's games

title: Data Updates (Internal MLB TE Team Only)
custom_preconds: Given a user has MLB app installed
custom_steps:
When a user is observing a live game
or a strung game in QA
custom_expected: Then the data will update accordingly

custom_steps_separated.content: iPhone on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning including States, Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: iPad on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: iPhone Scoreboard (collapsed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, Score, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: iPhone Scoreboard (expanded)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths, Pitcher, Batter

custom_steps_separated.content: iPad Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths, Pitcher, Batter

title: Gameday - Switching Games
custom_preconds: Given a user has MLB app installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in Gameday
and switches between games in the OOTSB (iPad)
or switches between games on the Scoreboard (iPad/iPhone)

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and another live game
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a live game and game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a final game and a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a final game and a game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Live game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches final game and a game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

title: Gameday - Switching Games (Offseason)
custom_preconds: Given a user has MLB app installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in Gameday
and switches between games in the OOTSB (iPad)
or switches between games on the Scoreboard (iPad/iPhone)

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a game in preview and another game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches between a final game and a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Game Preview and none of the previous games information is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: and switches final game and a game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the new game data loads in the Wrao game view and none of the previous games information is displayed

title: Lite User Gating (Not Logged In OR Non-privileges Account) -> To be automated (Osmani)
custom_preconds: Given a Lite user opens MLB app
custom_steps: Then the user should see the following when they perform the action

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on the Audio (headphones) button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees an Audio Paywall
with Monthly and Yearly options

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on MLB.TV (TV) button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees a MLB.TV Premium Upsell Banner
and tapping on it launches the MLB.TV Paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees a MLB.TV Paywall
with current location check message

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a Free Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees Login and Register webview
and they can play the feed after going through flow

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a game cell on the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees Gameday with 
ad placements
stadium and batter image
Pitch by Pitch data

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on Gameday > Videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sees highlights w/ preroll ad

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps between tabs in the app (News, Videos, Standings) (CANNOT BE AUTOMATED)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sees ads

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on Audio button from Browse Menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees an Audio upsell button
and tapping launches the Audio paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a Non-Free Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees Login and Register webview
and they should see the paywall.

title: General App UX-> Partially Automated (depends on user experience)
custom_preconds: Given a user has MLB app installed on an iPad and iPhone
custom_steps: When a user has the app open

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping between games on the Team Page Schedule/Scores module
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping vertically on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping between games on the Scoreboard (collapsed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping between games on the Scoreboard (expanded)
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping vertically on the news index
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

title: Time Zone Check
custom_preconds:
Settings > General > Time Zone

http://www.timezonecheck.com/

Use attached spreadsheet if needed.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to ET (NYC) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (ET). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to CT (Chicago) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (CT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to MT (Salt Lake City) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (MT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to PT (San Francisco) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (PT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to Bogota (UTC−05:00) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time but no time zone. Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to Cancun (same time as CT) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time but no time zone (CT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to Chihuahua (same time as MT) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time but no time zone (MT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to Tijuana (same time as PT) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time but no time zone (PT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to London or Tokyo and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time but no time zone. Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to 24 hour time and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
Gameday Preview
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the data loads
And the app does not crash

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the MLB Network page via the More Menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the schedule will load and be displayed in Eastern Time, regardless of the user's timezone

title: MLB Network
custom_preconds: Given a user has MLB app installed on an iPad and iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the Watch Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the MLB Network tab at the top of the page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps to open the MLB Network view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the MLB Network view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Play button to launch MLB Network
AND is logged into an account that is not entitled to watch MLB Network content
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to an MVPD flow to authenticate using their cable credentials

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user successfully authenticates using their cable credentials
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB Network stream will launch

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user leaves the app and relaunches it
and navs back to the MLB Network tab
and taps the Play button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB Network stream will launch
and the user will not have to re-authenticate

title: watch App
custom_preconds: Given user has an Apple watch that is synced to their iPhone
custom_steps:
When the user installs the MLB app on their iPhone
and installs the MLB app on their watch
custom_expected:
Then the watch app should properly install
and the user should be able to launch the watch app and view its tabs

title: Paywall - Adobe Test & Target
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the test build from TestFlight

(Please see https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/2384330816/Adobe+Test+Target+-+How+to+test+paywall+target+adding+devices#Testing-Paywall-Target-in-Pre-release-test-builds for how to set this up)
custom_steps: When the app's paywalls have been targeted for users with a favorite team set

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a not-entitled user views the Onboarding paywall
after having selected a favorite team during onboarding
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a favorite team-specific image on the onboarding paywall

title: Universal Deep Links (Free Game) - App Backgrounded
custom_preconds:
Given there is a Free Game of the Day feed available (live or archive) on the current day

*If there are none, change device date to one that has this feed type available
custom_steps:
When the app is running in the background

Using the following tool:


https://storage.cloud.google.com/mobile-utils/DeepLinks/index.html

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is not logged-in and not entitled
and launches the universal deep link for the Free Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLBTV EPG will launch in the app
and the user will be prompted with the login screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is logged-in with a Free account
and launches the universal deep link for the Free Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLBTV EPG will launch in the app
and the Free Game's default feed will launch

(Favorite/Followed/home team)

title: Universal Deep Links (Free Game) - App Killed
custom_preconds:
Given there is a Free Game of the Day feed available (live or archive) on the current day

*If there are none, change device date to one that has this feed type available
custom_steps:
When the app is killed and is not running in the background

Using the following tool:


https://storage.cloud.google.com/mobile-utils/DeepLinks/index.html

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is not logged-in and not entitled
and launches the universal deep link for the Free Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLBTV EPG will launch in the app
and the user will be prompted with the login screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is logged-in with a Free account
and launches the universal deep link for the Free Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLBTV EPG will launch in the app
and the Free Game's default feed will launch

(Favorite/Followed/home team)

and launches the universal deep link for a video from the Featured section

When the user is logged-in with an account entitled for SVOD

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will launch  and the selected video will begin playback

title: Close Account Page (To be Automated) (Ricaro)
custom_preconds: * User is logged in with an active account
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the Account page
When the user clicks "Close Account"
And the user is brought to the "Request Account Deletion Page" 
And the User inputs their email and password
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to a page confirming the user wants to delete their account

title: User Closes Account
custom_preconds: * User first completes this test case C28961221
custom_steps:
Given the user selects the "Continue to Account Deletion"
When the user confirms they want their account deleted
custom_expected:
Then the user will be sent an email confirming they want to delete their account 
And the user will follow the link to delete their account 
And the users account will be deleted

title: App Navigation for Feature Flagged Watch Tab
custom_preconds: * Launch app and place in QA environment
custom_steps:
Given the user opens the app
When the user navigates to the scores page 
And the user sees and clicks the TV icon in the upper left hand corner of the screen
And the user is brought to the Watch section
custom_expected:
Then the user should see a "done" button 
And when the user selects the "done" button the user is brought back to the home page

title: Standings -> Page Opens From Bottom Nav Bar (automated)
custom_preconds: * user is on the home page
custom_steps:
Given the user is on the home page
When the user clicks "Standings"
custom_expected: The Standings page opens

title: Automated: Standings -> Division and Wild Card Tabs (automated)
custom_preconds: * User is in the Standings section of the app
custom_steps: Given the user switches between Divisional and Wildcard Tabs
custom_expected: Then Then the records and standings appear to be up to date & accurate

title: Standings -> Favorite Team Selected and is on the Divisional tab ((automated))
custom_steps: Given a user has a favorite team selected and is on the Divisional tab
custom_expected: Then the favorite team appears highlighted

title: Standings -> User Has a Favorite Team Selected and it is on the Divisional tab (automated)
custom_steps: Given the user has a favorite team selected and it is on the Divisional tab
custom_expected: Then the division of the favorite team is on top

title: User Uses Promo Code -> User does not Have App Downloaded
custom_preconds:
* User generates prod facing promo code this is done through app store connect (services -> Promo Codes) https://appstoreconnect.apple.com/apps/493619333/features/promo_codes/generate

* User does NOT have the app downloaded

* App must be submitted to apple for review to be able to begin this test
User navigates to app store connect and creates promo codes for the appropriate build
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the app store on the device and hits the account button in the upper right hand corner
When the user pushes "Redeem Gift Card or Code" and then selects "Enter Code Manually"
And the user inputs one of the promo codes they generated
custom_expected: Then the app will automatically download and open

title: User Uses Promo Code -> User Has App Downloaded
custom_preconds:
* User generates prod facing promo code this is done through app store connect (services -> Promo Codes) https://appstoreconnect.apple.com/apps/493619333/features/promo_codes/generate

* User has the app downloaded

* App must be submitted to apple for review to be able to begin this test
User navigates to app store connect and creates promo codes for the appropriate build
custom_steps:
Given the user navigates to the app store on the device and hits the account button in the upper right hand corner
When the user pushes "Redeem Gift Card or Code" and then selects "Enter Code Manually"
And the user inputs one of the promo codes they generated
custom_expected: Then the app will open

title: Configure Account Icon (automated)
custom_preconds: * User is logged in and is either on the Home, News or Standings Tab
custom_steps:
GIVEN I am either on the Home, Standings or News tabs
WHEN I look in the top left corner
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an account icon (in white)
AND tapping that icon will launch the account settings

title: Bottom Nav Bar -> Watch Icon (automated)
custom_preconds:
* User has latest version downloaded
* User is signed in
custom_steps:
GIVEN I am Signed in
WHEN I look at the bottom nav bar from any tab by way of the bottom navigation menu
custom_expected: Then the watch icon will be visible in the bottom Nav Bar

title: Top Nav Bar -> Audio Icon (To be automated)
custom_preconds:
* User has latest version downloaded
* User is signed in
custom_steps:
GIVEN I am either on the Scores or Watch
WHEN I look in the top right corner
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Audio icon furthest to the right
AND tapping that icon will launch the Audio Feed

title: Top Nav Bar -> Chromecast is Visible
custom_preconds:
* User has latest version downloaded
* User is signed in
custom_steps:
GIVEN that I am on network with a cast-able device
WHEN I look at the top right corner
custom_expected: THEN Cast will be to the left of the Audio icon

title: Gameday -> Top Nav Bar-Audio Button Added
custom_preconds: * User has latest build downloaded
custom_steps: GIVEN a user launches gameday
custom_expected:
WHEN the webview stack is pushed
THEN a nav bar should appear
And a Back button will be displayed on the left
And a Gameday label
AND an Audio button may be displayed (right most)

title: Targeting of User Entitlements for Gameday 3D
custom_steps:
GIVEN a user is entitled for MLB.TV or At Bat

WHEN the user launches Gameday within the app

THEN the user’s entitlement info will be passed through to Gameday

subsequently, 

GIVEN a user is entitled for MLB.TV or At Bat

WHEN the user launches Gameday within the app

and taps the Gameday 3D button
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to seamlessly launch Gameday 3D, without being prompted with a paywall or to log in.

title: Scoreboard Refresh (To be automated)
custom_preconds:
* Ensure user is on latest build
* Ensure live game is being played or game can be strung
custom_steps:
Given a live game is being played
And a user navigates to to Scores Tab
When a user taps a game cell to launch Gameday
And then returns to Scoreboard from Gameday
custom_expected: Then scoreboard should refresh and then continue to poll every 15 number of seconds without having to close and re-open the app

title: Add MLB.tv button to Gameday webview
custom_preconds: * User is logged in with account that has access to view live streams
custom_steps:
Given user has navigated to gameday view 
When the user looks up to the top Nav Bar
custom_expected: Then the user will see the TV (watch icon)

title: Add MLB.tv button to Gameday webview -> When Button Clicked, User is Brought to Game
custom_preconds:
* User is logged in with account that has access to view live streams
* User is on Gameday View
custom_steps:
Given the user is on Gameday 
When the user clicks the TV icon at the top right of the screen
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the game and can consume content

title: Configure Account Icon/User Is Not Logged In (automated)
custom_preconds: * User is not logged in and is either on the Home, News or Standings Tab
custom_steps:
GIVEN I am either on the Home, Standings or News tabs
WHEN I look in the top left corner
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a login button
AND tapping that button will bring the user to the login screen

title: Player Page -> Implement Native Follow Button
custom_steps:
GIVEN the user is on the player page
WHEN the page loads
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a button allowing the user to follow or unfollow the player
AND when the user taps that button the user will follow or unfollow that player and have those changes written to the profile service so they will display anywhere I have followed players (e.g. Fieldpass within the app, on web, in my followed players carousel etc.)

title: Player page - Verify the loading indicator displayed on the player page when favorite team is selected
custom_preconds:
User has latest MLB app installed 
User has favorite team selected
custom_steps: GIVEN the user taps on the player image
custom_expected:
THEN a loading indicator is displayed on the top of the player page
and the indicator should have team color tinting

title: Player page - Verify the loading indicator displayed on the player page when favorite team is not selected
custom_preconds:
User has latest MLB app installed
favorite team is not selected
custom_steps: GIVEN the user taps on the player image
custom_expected: THEN a loading indicator is displayed on the top of the player page

title: Onboarding - Signup from Welcome Screen (automated)
custom_steps:
Given that user is on welcome screen
Then user should be able to sign up to MLB
and favorite teams and players should be stored in midfield.

custom_steps_separated.content: Open MLB app.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Open MLB app.

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on signup button.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Signup screen should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Enter all mandatory fields with valid data, then click on continue.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Success screen should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Click on continue button.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Onboarding flow should be started.

custom_steps_separated.content: Follow any team and players, then finish the onboarding flow.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Home page should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings and validate username and logout buttons are displayed.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Username and logout button should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings > My players and teams, Then validate that followed teams and players in step 5 are displayed.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Teams and players followed should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Open MLB app.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Welcome Screen should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Enter username and password then click on login.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Onboarding should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Finish onboarding flow following any team and players.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Home page should be displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings page.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Validate username and logout button are displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: Navigate to settings > My players & teams and validate that teams and players followed in step 3 are displayed.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Teams and players followed are displayed correctly.

custom_steps:

When the user clicks "browse menu"

custom_expected: The Standings page opens

1. The user is testing paywall launch points in the app

WHEN

1. The user launches the MLB app for the first time after a fresh install

OR

1. The user taps on the MLB.tv banner in the Games tab

OR

1. The user attempts to launch an MLB.tv stream via button on scoreboard

OR

1. The user attempts to launch paid-entitlement content on the Watch Now page
custom_expected:
THEN

1. The MLB.tv paywall SKU should launch successfully

AND

1. MLB.tv and At Bat Monthly/Yearly SKUs should be available

title: Deep Link Support->Gameday

* User is signed in
* Game is not in preview

custom_steps_separated.content: mlbatbat://game?gamepk=662571&game_tab=plays
custom_steps_separated.expected: User will be taken to Plays Tab of Game-day

custom_steps_separated.expected: User will be taken to boxscore tab of Game-Day

custom_steps_separated.content: mlbatbat://game?gamepk=662571&game_tab=summary
custom_steps_separated.expected: User will be taken the summary page of Game-Day

title: Updated Splash Screen -> With Sponsor -> 3 Second Splash Screen (to be automated)
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build downloaded
* Sponsor is active
custom_steps:
GIVEN that the app is launched from a cold start
WHEN the splash screen is displayed
AND there is a paying sponsor
custom_expected:
THEN the splash screen will display for at least 3 seconds 
AND the user will see sponsor at the bottom of the page. EG-"Presented by Camping World"

title: Updated Splash Screen -> Without Sponsor (to be automated)
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build downloaded
* No Sponsor is active
custom_steps:
GIVEN that the app is launched from a cold start
WHEN the splash screen is displayed
AND there is not a paying sponsor
custom_expected: THEN the splash screen will display for at least 1.5 seconds (depending on network)
